Consolidated Balance Sheets are categorized based upon observable or unobservable inputs used to estimate fair value. Level inputs are as follows:	Level Input:	Input Definition:	Level I	Inputs are unadjusted, quoted prices for identical assets or liabilities in active markets at the measurement date.	Level II	Inputs other than quoted prices included in Level I that are observable for the asset or liability through corroboration with market data at the measurement date.	Level III	Unobservable inputs that reflect management s best estimate of what market participants would use in pricing the asset or liability at the measurement date.
